privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.content:
1. Controller

The controller responsible for the processing of personal data on this website is:
Kinder- und Elternzentrum \"Kolibri\" e. V.
Ritzenbergstrasse 3
01067 Dresden, Germany
E-mail: Berufsorientierung@kolibri-dresden.de

2. Purpose of data processing

We process your personal data in order to operate the \"Berufsorientierung\" web application, in particular for the following purposes:

  • Registration of user accounts and authentication,
  • Registration for events and management of participant lists,
  • Sending e-mails (confirmations, information about events, newsletters where applicable),
  • Compliance with legal retention and documentation obligations,
  • Ensuring system security (logging, abuse prevention, bot protection).

3. Categories of data

Depending on how you use the website, we process in particular the following categories of data:

  • Master data: name, e-mail address, contact details, preferred language.
  • Address data: street, house number, postal code, city.
  • Birth date and consents: e.g. photo/video consent, GDPR consent, parental consent where required.
  • Event registration data: selected event, additional form fields, registration and cancellation information.
  • Log data: IP address, timestamps, actions performed in the admin area (activity log).

4. Legal basis

Data processing is based on the following legal grounds according to the GDPR:

  • Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (performance of a contract): registration and participation in events.
  • Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR (consent): optional information and newsletters, where applicable.
  • Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR (legal obligation): statutory retention obligations.
  • Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interests): IT security, detection of misuse and statistical evaluations in anonymised form.

5. Use of service providers and data transfers

We use technical service providers to operate this application, in particular:

  • Cloudflare Workers, D1 and R2: hosting, database and file storage (e.g. QR codes for messenger groups).
  • MailChannels: sending e-mails (e.g. registration confirmations).

Processing may take place on servers outside the EU/EEA. Cloudflare and MailChannels act as processors. Appropriate safeguards within the meaning of the GDPR (e.g. standard contractual clauses or comparable mechanisms) are used to ensure an adequate level of data protection.

6. Cookies, Turnstile and log files

We use technically necessary cookies to manage your session and login (e.g. authentication cookies, CSRF protection).

To protect against bots, we use the \"Cloudflare Turnstile\" service. Technical information (such as IP address and browser data) may be transmitted to Cloudflare in order to distinguish real users from automated requests. Processing is based on our legitimate interest in the security and stability of our service (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR).

When you access the website, server log files are also collected (e.g. IP address, date and time of access, pages viewed) in order to detect attacks and ensure security.

7. Storage period and deletion

We store personal data only for as long as necessary for the purposes described or as required by law.

  • User accounts and event data are generally stored while an active user relationship exists.
  • After the last participation in an event, data may be deleted or anonymised after a certain period.
  • In certain cases, an archive of deleted users with minimal information is kept to demonstrate compliance with legal obligations.

8. Your rights

You have the following rights in relation to your personal data:

  • Right of access (Art. 15 GDPR),
  • Right to rectification (Art. 16 GDPR),
  • Right to erasure (Art. 17 GDPR),
  • Right to restriction of processing (Art. 18 GDPR),
  • Right to data portability (Art. 20 GDPR),
  • Right to object (Art. 21 GDPR).

Where processing is based on your consent, you may withdraw this consent at any time with effect for the future.

You also have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority. The competent authority is, in particular, the data protection authority of the federal state of Saxony.

9. Contact for privacy matters

If you have any questions regarding data protection or wish to exercise your rights, please contact:
Kinder- und Elternzentrum \"Kolibri\" e. V.
Ritzenbergstrasse 3, 01067 Dresden, Germany
E-mail: Berufsorientierung@kolibri-dresden.de

10. Changes to this Privacy Policy

We may amend this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in legal requirements or in our services. The current version published on this website applies.
